column1: Novokuybyshevsk (Russian: Новоку́йбышевск) is a city in Samara Oblast
column3: located on the eastern bank of the Volga River
column4: 6 kilometers (3.7 mi) away from it. Population: 108

column2: the area where the city now stands was a place of ferocious battles with the White Russians.

column3: the Soviets constructed an oil refinery in Novokuybyshevsk
column4: which resulted in the establishment of a large village of approximately 14
column5: 000 people. The location soon turned out to be so advantageous that the government decided to develop the village into a major industrial center. In September 1951
column6: the first working refineries started operating
column9: following the decision of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the RSFSR
column10: Novo-Kuybyshev was granted town status and renamed Novokuybyshevsk.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as the city of oblast significance of Novokuybyshevsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the city of oblast significance of Novokuybyshevsk is incorporated as Novokuybyshevsk Urban Okrug.

column3: as well as plants such as Petrochemicals
